attributes.comment:
Please reconsider the fee increases for the proposal "Adjustment of the
Immigration Benefit Application/ Petition and Biometric Fee Schedule".
This effects everyone adopting a child internationally. The costs for such an
endeavor are already extremely high and additional costs added by our own
country are unecessary. As it is, it amounts to over $1000 in USCIS fees for the
average family between the I600 A and fingerprints for two ($665) and the I-600
($380). I really think that is already a substantial amount to pay. In addition,
those of us needing the Certificate of Citizenship get to pay for one if only one
spouse travels, while they are issued automatically (for FREE) to families with
both parents travelling. I think given that some of us are having to pay for
documents that are given to others for free, the cost for the document is already
high enough.

Thank you.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Dawn W
